sentences.english: His spiritual depression came to an end when she kissed him.
sentences.chinese: 她的亲吻扫除了他精神上的苦闷。

sentences.english: Grief and despair fill my heart.
sentences.chinese: 哀伤与苦闷充满我的心。

sentences.english: Actor cruel is experiencing this kind of trustful crisis dejectedly .
sentences.chinese: 优酷就正在苦闷地感受这种信任危机。

sentences.english: As your wedding-ring wears, your cares will wear away.
sentences.chinese: 结婚戒指戴旧了，苦闷也就消除了。

sentences.english: For I have inebriated the weary soul: and I have filled every hungry soul.
sentences.chinese: 因为我要振作困乏的心灵，饱饫一切苦闷的心灵。

sentences.english: She seemed really weird, like some kind of sex-crazed vampire, " Romero recalls."
sentences.chinese: 她看起来很怪异，像是某种性苦闷的吸血鬼。

sentences.english: Heart not happy, or something when I want to say?
sentences.chinese: 心并苦闷乐，或是当我想说什么呢？

sentences.english: And let me be Your moon, To mercifully end Your anguished day.
sentences.chinese: 我愿是您明月，疼爱地终止您苦闷的一天。

sentences.english: He was very distressed has been no answer, so incognito travel.
sentences.chinese: 他很苦闷一直没有答案，于是便微服私访。

sentences.english: New Year arrived, the big straight saw the fathers lonely and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 新年到了，大直看到了父亲的孤独和苦闷。

sentences.english: THIS has been a year of sackcloth and ashes for the world’s business schools.
sentences.chinese: 这是让全世界商学院都感到苦闷的一年。

sentences.english: One theory is that people with mental distress eat more junk food.
sentences.chinese: 有个理论说，精神苦闷的人会吃更多的垃圾食品。

sentences.english: I watched the minutes 18)agonizingly tick by on a clock on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我苦闷地盯着墙上的时钟，指针走了一圈又一圈。

sentences.english: I could not live on as I was living, and I have come.
sentences.chinese: 我心里太苦闷，不能再那样活下去，所以我来了。

sentences.english: Ann: I know you have been repressed your emotion for a long time, and you need give vent to your pain.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你压抑了很久，你需要发泄你内心的苦闷。

sentences.english: Since death is immanent in life, almost all of life is an agony.
sentences.chinese: 由于死固有于生，因此几乎所有的生活都是一种苦闷。

definition: to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
